Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Member of the Scientific Board of CoSMo. Comparative Studies in Modernism. Open access journal.
Member of the Scientific Board of “Contrasti. Collana di Critica e Arte Contemporanea”, Altralinea Edizioni (Florence, Italy).
Member of the Advisory Board of CIRSDE (Centro Interdisciplinare di Ricerche e Studi delle Donne e di Genere).
Member of the Scientific Board of “Sviluppo della persona ed esercizio dei diritti umani”. Sezione di Migrazione e diritti umani. Aracne Editrice.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “Silenzio, memoria e nevrosi in Passaggio in ombra di Mariateresa di Lascia.” XVII AAIS Conference, Wakeforest University, Winston-Salem, NC (USA).
"Dalle Langhe al Giappone, da Barnum a Seta: in viaggio con Alessandro Baricco." XVIII AAIS Conference, Loyola University, Chicago, IL (USA).
“Something Old, Something New, Something Borrowed, Something Blue. Translator As (Un)faithful Bride in Francesca Duranti's La casa sul lago della luna.” AAIS, Eugene, OR (USA).

“The Hallucinatory Power of Water: Irony and Liquid Fear in Ambrose Bierce’s Works”. 9th SAAS International Conference. "Water and American Renewal: Critical Readings, Political Interventions." Barcelona, Spain.
“’A billion scraps of paper’: Tarantula di Bob Dylan”. "L’accento acuto del presente". University of Turin. INVITED.

“From Langston Hughes’ Not Without Laughter (1930) to Langston Hughes’ Piccola America negra (1968): Where’s the Music Gone?”. XX Biennial AISNA International Conference. "Translating America. Importing, Translating, Misrepresenting, Mythicizing, Communicating America". University of Turin. PANEL ORGANIZER AND CHAIR.
“E.A. Poe and his Readers: the Reception of his Journalistic Activity in America and in Italy”. The Third International Edgar Allan Poe Conference: The Bicentennial. Philadelphia, PA (USA).
“E.A. Poe’s ‘The System of Dr. Tarr and Prof. Fether’: Siting America’s Insanity.” 3rd Global Conference. Madness: Probing the Boundaries. Oriel College, Oxford, United Kingdom.

“Words and/as Trash in Paul Auster’s In the Country of Last Things.” XXI AISNA Biennial International Conference. Democracy and Difference. The United States in Multidisciplinary and Comparative Perspectives. University of Trento. PANEL ORGANIZER AND CHAIR.

“Taming the Wild to Tame Oneself: Nature, Legacy, and Suicide in David Vann’s Sukkwan Island.” Reading Nature. Cultural Perspectives on Environmental Imagery. Facultad De Filología, Universidad Complutense, Madrid.

“A Heartbreaking Personal Story of a Staggering National Disaster: Dave Eggers’ Zeitoun.” 2012 Biennial EAAS (European Association for American Studies) Conference. The Health of the Nation. Izmir, Turkey.

“Meat, Somaesthetics, and Trans-corporeality: Mediated Body Consciousness in Ruth Ozeki’s My Year of Meats”, 11th International SAAS Conference: “TRANS”: The Poetics and Politics of Crossing in the US. Universidad de La Laguna, Tenerife, Spain.

“ContaminAzioni ecologiche: cibi, nature, culture / Ecological Contamina(c)tions: Food, Natures, Cultures”. First Conference on Ecocriticism. University of Turin. CHIEF ORGANIZER AND STEERING COMMITTEE

“Oltre l’antropocentrismo: il sublime ecologico nel contesto anglo-americano”. Il Sublime e le arti: dal tragico al Kitsch, dall’arte alla natura. University of Turin, Centro Studi Arti della Modernità. INVITED.

“Blatant Lies and Subterranean Truths: Climate Change and the Media in Barbara Kingsolver’s Flight Bahavior”. 11th Biennial Conference of the Association for the Study of Literature and Environment (ASLE). Notes from the Underground: The Depths of Environmental Arts, Culture, and Justice. University of Idaho, Moscow, ID (USA).

“Food, Health, and Wellbeing in Ruth Ozeki’s My Year of Meats (1998) and Anita Desai’s Fasting, Feasting (1999)”. AISCLI Summer School: World Cultures and Literatures in English: Welfare, Well-Being, Living Well, University of Turin. INVITED.

“Harboring the Trash of the World: Edward Burtynsky’s Photography”. XXIII AISNA Biennial Conference: Harbors Flows and Migrations of Peoples, Cultures, and Ideas. The U.S.A. in/and the World, University of Naples “L’Orientale”

International Cultural Festival “Alla tavola delle migranti” (At the Migrants’ Table). Aula Magna Cavallerizza Reale, University of Turin. (17/09/2016). [www.allatavoladellemigranti.it]. CHIEF CO-ORGANIZER AND STEERING COMMITTEE

Introduction to Monique Truong’s writings. AISCLI Summer School: Environmental Humanities, Digital Humanities and Human Rights, Dept. of Foreign Languages, Literatures and Modern Cultures. University of Turin. (19/09/2016). INVITED.
“At the Migrants’ Table: Food, Women and Migrations in Italy”. “Savoring Italy”. Department of Italian, Smith College, Northampton, MA. (19/10/2016). INVITED.
Il cibo degli umanisti / Food for the Humanities. University of Turin. (11/11/2016). [www.cibodegliumanisti.it]. CHIEF CO-ORGANIZER AND STEERING COMMITTEE (with Prof. Massimo Bonifazio).

“Il cibo nella letteratura anglo-americana contemporanea: una prospettiva ecocritica”. Il cibo degli umanisti / Food for the Humanities. (Co-organized with Prof. Massimo Bonifazio). University of Turin. (11/11/2016). [www.cibodegliumanisti.it].

“Anthroposcenaries: Ecologies, Landscapes, and Stories / Antroposcenari: storie, paesaggi, ecologie”. Joint International conference of Environmental Humanities International Research Group, Dept. of Languages and Modern Foreign Literatures and Cultures (Lingue e Letterature Straniere e Culture Moderne) and Transnational Appetites (Studi Umanistici). University of Turin. (30-31/05/2017). CHIEF CO-ORGANIZER (with Prof. S. Iovino) AND STEERING COMMITTEE

“Cambiamenti climatici e migrazioni: una lettura ecofemminista di La collina delle farfalle di Barbara Kingsolver.” 25 anni di studi di genere (25 years of Gender Studies). With President Laura Boldrini. Cirsde, University of Turin, 1-2/12/2016. OPENING CONFERENCE. INVITED.

FULBRIGHT Scholarship. University of Massachusetts, Amherst, MA. Dept. of Comparative Literature
Graduate Teaching Assistant. Dept. of French and Italian. University of Massachusetts, Amherst, MA USA) - Italian Literature and Culture. Italian Language courses.
Visiting Lecturer. Dept. of Spanish and Italian. Mount Holyoke College, South Hadley, MA (USA). Coordinator and Director of Italian Language courses. Italian Literature and Culture.
CEMS (Center for European and Mediterranean Studies) Visiting Scholarship, New York University, New York (USA).

Master in Journalism. English for the Media. University of Turin.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Progetto di Ateneo (Compagnia di San Paolo): “Transnational Appetites: Migrant Women’s Art and Writing on Food and the Environment”. 2014 Calls for research proposals co-funded by CSP.
